intro: Myonima heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf myonima, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to linear, depending on environmental conditions. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Myonima heterophylla is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
